title: Update Calcite to 1.35.0 to support the use of `TIMESTAMP_TRUNC` functions under sqlFederation
body:
Fixes #25320.

Changes proposed in this pull request:
  - Update Calcite to 1.35.0 to support the use of `TIMESTAMP_TRUNC` functions under sqlFederation. Refer to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-5269 . This also adds follow time functions support.
      - `TIME_TRUNC`, `DATE_TRUNC`
      - `TIMESTAMP_ADD`, `TIME_ADD`/`TIME_DIFF`
      - `DATE_SUB`, `TIME_SUB`, `TIMESTAMP_SUB`
  - Some breaking updates at the Calcite milestone resulted in `org.apache.shardingsphere.sqlfederation.compiler.it.SQLStatementCompilerIT` having 4 test cases to change.

---

title: [Oracle SQL] Support parsing of XMLElement and XMLCdata Function
body: The related issues is: https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/issues/27569 In this pr, I supported the parsing of basic components of XMLElement and XMLCdata Function of Oracle. Now, the HR-5-204 & HR-5-208 can be parsed correcly. The Example SQL is : `SELECT XMLELEMENT("PurchaseOrder", XMLAttributes(dummy as "pono"), XMLCdata(' ]>')) "XMLCData" FROM DUAL;` I refered to the offical doc of Oracle: https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/21/sqlrf/XMLELEMENT.html#GUID-DEA75423-00EA-4034-A246-4A774ADC988E https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/21/sqlrf/XMLCDATA.html#GUID-FB517A52-6F1A-4D8D-B632-F91EFA606691

title: [Oracle SQL] Support REF column in create table clause
body: In this PR, I fixed the follwing SQL: `CREATE TABLE location_table (location_number NUMBER, building REF warehouse_typ SCOPE IS warehouse_table);` REF column is allowd in ColumnDefinitionClause of Oracle, the references are listed here: https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/21/sqlrf/CREATE-TABLE.html#GUID-F9CE0CC3-13AE-4744-A43C-EAC7A71AAAB6 https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/21/adobj/design-considerations-for-REFs.html#GUID-078BD058-FE2C-4FC5-8418-CD95F085CBD6 The related issue: https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/issues/27569

title: Disable the implementation of Etcd during the build of ShardingSphere Proxy Native
body:
For #21347.

Changes proposed in this pull request:
  - Disable the implementation of Etcd during the build of ShardingSphere Proxy Native. Refer to https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/issues/21347#issuecomment-1685514896.
  - In #28099, the introduction of `io.grpc:grpc-netty-shaded:1.51.0` lacks the corresponding GraalVM Reachability Metadata, but GraalVM Team does not finish discussing whether GraalVM Reachability Metadata should be collected for shaded packages. As a temporary measure, related submodules are disabled during the build of Native Image. Refer to https://github.com/micronaut-projects/micronaut-gcp/issues/532 .
